Legal_Issue: Whether the Respondent's trademark BOJANGLES CAFÉ was distinctive
Procedural_Stage: Appeal from Trademarks Opposition Board decision
Evidence_Assessment: Applicants' evidence of mark presence in Canada through advertising and customer exposure
Burden_of_Proof: Applicants failed to prove substantial reputation in Canada
Legal_Rule: Under s. 6(5) of the Trade-marks Act, a trademark is distinctive if it distinguishes wares or services
Procedural_Issue: Board applied incorrect standard requiring 'well known' status
Grounds_for_Claim: Opposition to trademark registration based on prior use and reputation
Applicant_Challenge: Bojangles International, LLC opposed registration by Bojangles Café Ltd.
Standard_of_Proof: Substantial reputation in Canada required to negate distinctiveness
Defendant_Response: Maintained that BOJANGLES CAFÉ was distinctive
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of sufficient reputation to negate distinctiveness
Applicable_Process: Trademark opposition proceeding followed by appeal
